conclusion: Analyze the given information and properties of the ideal gas law.
Ideal gas law equation: PV = nRT.
Definitions of variables in the ideal gas law.
Volume decreases from 40 L at state A to 20 L at state B.
Gas is compressed from state A to state B.
Use ideal gas law to find number of moles n at state A.
Calculate n = 100 moles at state A.
Need to find temperature at state B.
Pressure increases from 4 atm to 2 atm from state A to state B.
Use ideal gas law to find temperature at state B.
Temperature of the gas at state B is 1000K.
